because it is spontaneous reaction.even if you will take only zinc beaker and zinc rod dipped in it zinc will lose electrons this is marked while doing experiment as zinc rod becomes thinner and shorter.so it is not that copper half cell is connected that's why zinc loses electron even without copper zinc does so.it is to be noted that copper also loses electron when not connected with zinc but when gets connected with zinc by conducting wire zinc has greater oxidation potential as compared to copper (go through electrochemical series )so zinc wins and gets oxidized, as oxidation can not occur alone there has to be reduction so copper gets reduced .
